snippet: A new show, “Mulaney,” on Fox, goes against the grain for network TV by using the traditional multicamera comedy format, shot on a stage with a studio audience.
abstract: Fox's new sitcom Mulaney, starring writer and comedian John Mulaney, goes against the grain for network TV by using traditional multicamera comedy format, shot on a stage with a studio audience; multicamera comedies, in which people can be heard laughing at the jokes, seem to only work on CBS.
lead_paragraph: A new show, “Mulaney,” on Fox, goes against the grain for network TV by using the traditional multicamera comedy format, shot on a stage with a studio audience.

headline.seo: Fox's 'Mulaney' Is Taped Before a Live Studio Audience
headline.main: New Sitcom Tries Old Form: Laughs Allowed
headline.print_headline: New Sitcom Tries Old Form: Laughs Allowed
